answerText: dark matter [10] Experiments such AMANDA and the Soudan Mine have focused on the detection of these dark matter candidates, which are particles thought to have amass of around 100 GeV, and are favored over massive astronomical compact halo objects.
heading: ACF Winter |2009 | University of Illinois A and Missouri State A and University of South Carolina A | 2 | Science | Other | College
subject: Science
question: Question: This hypothetical substance's existence was first inferred by Fritz Zwicky after mass calculations based on brightness deviated from those based on gravitational effects by a factor of 400.  [10] This invisible substance may constitute from 90-99% of the universe's matter, but is invisible to any detection method relying on electromagnetic radiation, such as human sight.
